svcsubproc.title: LO Range Gear and Output Shaft

note.para: Make sure magnetic plugs are installed in the auxiliary housing.

step1.para: Mark timing teeth on the LO Range gear ( Figure 153). A highly visible color of toolmaker's dye is recommended.

figure.caption: Figure 153. Mark Timing Teeth on LO Range Gear

step2.para: Mark any two adjacent gear teeth on LO Range gear, front side.
Mark the two adjacent teeth which are directly opposite the first set marked. There should be the same number of teeth between the markings on each side of the gear.

step1.para: Place the splined washer on the output shaft shoulder facing up as shown ( Figure 154).

figure.caption: Figure 154. Place Splined Washer on Output Shaft Shoulder

step1.para: Install the LO Range gear on the output shaft, clutching teeth engaged with the splines down to engage the washer splines ( Figure 155).

figure.caption: Figure 155. Install LO Range Gear on Output Shaft

step1.para: Install the LO Range gear rear washer on the output shaft and against the gear, with chamfer side facing up ( Figure 156).

figure.caption: Figure 156. Install LO Range Gear Rear Washer on Output Shaft

step1.para: Use a heat lamp or hot plate and oil to heat the output shaft rear bearing and install on the output shaft ( Figure 157). Seat the bearing securely on the shaft. Bearing can also be installed using the appropriate driver.

figure.caption: Figure 157. Heat and Install Output Shaft Rear Bearing

step1.para: Install the bearing inner spacer on the output shaft ( Figure 158).

figure.caption: Figure 158. Install Bearing Inner Spacer on Output Shaft

step1.para: Place the auxiliary housing on a flat bench and install the 2 bearing cups and spacer in the rear bearing bore ( Figure 159). The cup with a lip seats next to the rear of the auxiliary case.

figure.caption: Figure 159. Install Bearing Cups and Spacer
